26 #ifndef REACTPHYSICS3D_SET_H
27 #define REACTPHYSICS3D_SET_H
28 
29 // Libraries
30 #include <reactphysics3d/memory/MemoryAllocator.h>
31 #include <reactphysics3d/mathematics/mathematics_functions.h>
32 #include <cstring>
33 #include <stdexcept>

37 namespace reactphysics3d {
38 
39 // Class Set
44 template<typename V, class Hash = std::hash<V>, class KeyEqual = std::equal_to<V>>
45 class Set {
46 
47  private:
48 
49  // -------------------- Constants -------------------- //
50 
52  static constexpr float DEFAULT_LOAD_FACTOR = 0.75;
53 
55  static constexpr uint64 INVALID_INDEX = -1;
56 
57  // -------------------- Attributes -------------------- //
58 
60  uint64 mNbAllocatedEntries;
61 
63  uint64 mNbEntries;
64 
66  uint64 mHashSize ;
67 
69  uint64* mBuckets;
70 
72  V* mEntries;
73 
75  uint64* mNextEntries;
76 
78  MemoryAllocator& mAllocator;
79 
81  uint64 mFreeIndex;
82 
83  // -------------------- Methods -------------------- //
84 
86  uint64 findEntry(const V& value) const {
87 
88  if (mHashSize > 0) {
89 
90  const size_t hashCode = Hash()(value);
91  const size_t divider = mHashSize - 1;
92  const uint64 bucket = static_cast<uint64>(hashCode & divider);
93  auto keyEqual = KeyEqual();
94 
95  for (uint64 i = mBuckets[bucket]; i != INVALID_INDEX; i = mNextEntries[i]) {
96  if (Hash()(mEntries[i]) == hashCode && keyEqual(mEntries[i], value)) {
97  return i;
98  }
99  }
100  }
101 
102  return INVALID_INDEX;
103  }
104 
105  public:
106 
108 
111  class Iterator {
112 
113  private:
114 
116  const Set* mSet;
117 
119  uint64 mCurrentBucketIndex;
120 
122  uint64 mCurrentEntryIndex;
123 
125  void advance() {
126 
127  assert(mCurrentBucketIndex < mSet->mHashSize);
128  assert(mCurrentEntryIndex < mSet->mNbAllocatedEntries);
129 
130  // Try the next entry
131  if (mSet->mNextEntries[mCurrentEntryIndex] != INVALID_INDEX) {
132  mCurrentEntryIndex = mSet->mNextEntries[mCurrentEntryIndex];
133  return;
134  }
135 
136  // Try to move to the next bucket
137  mCurrentEntryIndex = 0;
138  mCurrentBucketIndex++;
139  while(mCurrentBucketIndex < mSet->mHashSize && mSet->mBuckets[mCurrentBucketIndex] == INVALID_INDEX) {
140  mCurrentBucketIndex++;
141  }
142  if (mCurrentBucketIndex < mSet->mHashSize) {
143  mCurrentEntryIndex = mSet->mBuckets[mCurrentBucketIndex];
144  }
145  }
146 
147  public:
148 
149  // Iterator traits
150  using value_type = V;
151  using difference_type = std::ptrdiff_t;
152  using pointer = V*;
153  using reference = V&;
154  using iterator_category = std::forward_iterator_tag;
155 
157  Iterator() = default;
158 
160  Iterator(const Set* set, uint64 bucketIndex, uint64 entryIndex)
161  :mSet(set), mCurrentBucketIndex(bucketIndex), mCurrentEntryIndex(entryIndex) {
162 
163  }
164 
166  reference operator*() const {
167  assert(mCurrentEntryIndex < mSet->mNbAllocatedEntries);
168  assert(mCurrentEntryIndex != INVALID_INDEX);
169  return mSet->mEntries[mCurrentEntryIndex];
170  }
171 
173  pointer operator->() const {
174  assert(mCurrentEntryIndex < mSet->mNbAllocatedEntries);
175  assert(mCurrentEntryIndex != INVALID_INDEX);
176  return &(mSet->mEntries[mCurrentEntryIndex]);
177  }
178 
180  Iterator& operator++() {
181  advance();
182  return *this;
183  }
184 
186  Iterator operator++(int) {
187  Iterator tmp = *this;
188  advance();
189  return tmp;
190  }
191 
193  bool operator==(const Iterator& iterator) const {
194  return mCurrentBucketIndex == iterator.mCurrentBucketIndex && mCurrentEntryIndex == iterator.mCurrentEntryIndex && mSet == iterator.mSet;
195  }
196 
198  bool operator!=(const Iterator& iterator) const {
199  return !(*this == iterator);
200  }
201  };
202 
203 
204  // -------------------- Methods -------------------- //
205 
207  Set(MemoryAllocator& allocator, uint64 capacity = 0)
208  : mNbAllocatedEntries(0), mNbEntries(0), mHashSize(0), mBuckets(nullptr),
209  mEntries(nullptr), mNextEntries(nullptr), mAllocator(allocator), mFreeIndex(INVALID_INDEX) {
210 
211  if (capacity > 0) {
212 
213  reserve(capacity);
214  }
215  }
216 
218  Set(const Set<V, Hash, KeyEqual>& set)
219  :mNbAllocatedEntries(set.mNbAllocatedEntries), mNbEntries(set.mNbEntries), mHashSize(set.mHashSize),
220  mBuckets(nullptr), mEntries(nullptr), mNextEntries(nullptr), mAllocator(set.mAllocator), mFreeIndex(set.mFreeIndex) {
221 
222  if (mHashSize > 0) {
223 
224  // Allocate memory for the buckets
225  mBuckets = static_cast<uint64*>(mAllocator.allocate(mHashSize * sizeof(uint64)));
226 
227  // Allocate memory for the entries
228  mEntries = static_cast<V*>(mAllocator.allocate(mNbAllocatedEntries * sizeof(V)));
229  mNextEntries = static_cast<uint64*>(mAllocator.allocate(mNbAllocatedEntries * sizeof(uint64)));
230 
231  // Copy the buckets array
232  std::memcpy(mBuckets, set.mBuckets, mHashSize * sizeof(uint64));
233 
234  // Copy the next entries indices
235  std::memcpy(mNextEntries, set.mNextEntries, mNbAllocatedEntries * sizeof(uint64));
236 
237  // Copy the entries
238  for (uint64 i=0; i<mHashSize; i++) {
239 
240  uint64 entryIndex = mBuckets[i];
241  while(entryIndex != INVALID_INDEX) {
242 
243  // Copy the entry to the new location and destroy the previous one
244  new (mEntries + entryIndex) V(set.mEntries[entryIndex]);
245 
246  entryIndex = mNextEntries[entryIndex];
247  }
248  }
249  }
250  }
251 
253  ~Set() {
254 
255  clear(true);
256  }
257 
259  void reserve(uint64 capacity) {
260 
261  if (capacity <= mHashSize) return;
262 
263  if (capacity < 16) capacity = 16;
264 
265  // Make sure we have a power of two size
266  if (!isPowerOfTwo(capacity)) {
267  capacity = nextPowerOfTwo64Bits(capacity);
268  }
269 
270  assert(capacity < INVALID_INDEX);
271 
272  assert(capacity > mHashSize);
273 
274  // Allocate memory for the buckets
275  uint64* newBuckets = static_cast<uint64*>(mAllocator.allocate(capacity * sizeof(uint64)));
276 
277  // Allocate memory for the entries
278  const uint64 nbAllocatedEntries = static_cast<uint64>(capacity * double(DEFAULT_LOAD_FACTOR));
279  assert(nbAllocatedEntries > 0);
280  V* newEntries = static_cast<V*>(mAllocator.allocate(nbAllocatedEntries * sizeof(V)));
281  uint64* newNextEntries = static_cast<uint64*>(mAllocator.allocate(nbAllocatedEntries * sizeof(uint64)));
282 
283  assert(newEntries != nullptr);
284  assert(newNextEntries != nullptr);
285 
286  // Initialize the new buckets
287  for (uint64 i=0; i<capacity; i++) {
288  newBuckets[i] = INVALID_INDEX;
289  }
290 
291  if (mNbAllocatedEntries > 0) {
292 
293  assert(mNextEntries != nullptr);
294 
295  // Copy the free nodes indices in the nextEntries array
296  std::memcpy(newNextEntries, mNextEntries, mNbAllocatedEntries * sizeof(uint64));
297  }
298 
299  // Recompute the buckets (hash) with the new hash size
300  for (uint64 i=0; i<mHashSize; i++) {
301 
302  uint64 entryIndex = mBuckets[i];
303  while(entryIndex != INVALID_INDEX) {
304 
305  // Get the corresponding bucket
306  const size_t hashCode = Hash()(mEntries[entryIndex]);
307  const size_t divider = capacity - 1;
308  const uint64 bucketIndex = static_cast<uint64>(hashCode & divider);
309 
310  newNextEntries[entryIndex] = newBuckets[bucketIndex];
311  newBuckets[bucketIndex] = entryIndex;
312 
313  // Copy the entry to the new location and destroy the previous one
314  new (newEntries + entryIndex) V(mEntries[entryIndex]);
315  mEntries[entryIndex].~V();
316 
317  entryIndex = mNextEntries[entryIndex];
318  }
319  }
320 
321  if (mNbAllocatedEntries > 0) {
322 
323  // Release previously allocated memory
324  mAllocator.release(mBuckets, mHashSize * sizeof(uint64));
325  mAllocator.release(mEntries, mNbAllocatedEntries * sizeof(V));
326  mAllocator.release(mNextEntries, mNbAllocatedEntries * sizeof(uint64));
327  }
328 
329  // Add the new entries to the free list
330  for (uint64 i=mNbAllocatedEntries; i < nbAllocatedEntries-1; i++) {
331  newNextEntries[i] = i + 1;
332  }
333  newNextEntries[nbAllocatedEntries - 1] = mFreeIndex;
334  mFreeIndex = mNbAllocatedEntries;
335 
336  mHashSize = capacity;
337  mNbAllocatedEntries = nbAllocatedEntries;
338  mBuckets = newBuckets;
339  mEntries = newEntries;
340  mNextEntries = newNextEntries;
341 
342  assert(mFreeIndex != INVALID_INDEX);
343  }
344 
346  bool contains(const V& value) const {
347  return findEntry(value) != INVALID_INDEX;
348  }
349 
352  bool add(const V& value) {
353 
354  uint64 bucket = INVALID_INDEX;
355 
356  // Compute the hash code of the value
357  const size_t hashCode = Hash()(value);
358 
359  if (mHashSize > 0) {
360 
361  // Compute the corresponding bucket index
362  const size_t divider = mHashSize - 1;
363  bucket = static_cast<uint64>(hashCode & divider);
364 
365  auto keyEqual = KeyEqual();
366 
367  // Check if the item is already in the set
368  for (uint64 i = mBuckets[bucket]; i != INVALID_INDEX; i = mNextEntries[i]) {
369 
370  // If there is already an item with the same value in the set
371  if (Hash()(mEntries[i]) == hashCode && keyEqual(mEntries[i], value)) {
372 
373  return false;
374  }
375  }
376  }
377 
378  uint64 entryIndex;
379 
380  // If there are no more free entries to use
381  if (mFreeIndex == INVALID_INDEX) {
382 
383  // Allocate more memory
384  reserve(mHashSize == 0 ? 16 : mHashSize * 2);
385 
386  // Recompute the bucket index
387  const size_t divider = mHashSize - 1;
388  bucket = static_cast<uint64>(hashCode & divider);
389  }
390 
391  assert(mNbEntries < mNbAllocatedEntries);
392  assert(mFreeIndex != INVALID_INDEX);
393 
394  // Get the next free entry
395  entryIndex = mFreeIndex;
396  mFreeIndex = mNextEntries[entryIndex];
397 
398  mNbEntries++;
399 
400  assert(bucket != INVALID_INDEX);
401 
402  mNextEntries[entryIndex] = mBuckets[bucket];
403  new (mEntries + entryIndex) V(value);
404  mBuckets[bucket] = entryIndex;
405 
406  return true;
407  }
408 
412  Iterator remove(const Iterator& it) {
413 
414  return remove(*it);
415  }
416 
420  Iterator remove(const V& value) {
421 
422  if (mHashSize > 0) {
423 
424  const size_t hashcode = Hash()(value);
425  auto keyEqual = KeyEqual();
426  const size_t divider = mHashSize - 1;
427  const size_t bucket = hashcode & divider;
428  uint64 last = INVALID_INDEX;
429  for (uint64 i = mBuckets[bucket]; i != INVALID_INDEX; last = i, i = mNextEntries[i]) {
430 
431  // If we have found the item
432  if (Hash()(mEntries[i]) == hashcode && keyEqual(mEntries[i], value)) {
433 
434  if (last == INVALID_INDEX) {
435  mBuckets[bucket] = mNextEntries[i];
436  }
437  else {
438  mNextEntries[last] = mNextEntries[i];
439  }
440 
441  uint64 nextEntryIndex = mNextEntries[i];
442  uint64 nextBucketIndex = bucket;
443 
444  mEntries[i].~V();
445  mNextEntries[i] = mFreeIndex;
446  mFreeIndex = i;
447  mNbEntries--;
448 
449  // Find the next entry to return an iterator
450  if (nextEntryIndex == INVALID_INDEX) {
451  nextEntryIndex = 0;
452  nextBucketIndex++;
453  while(nextBucketIndex < mHashSize && mBuckets[nextBucketIndex] == INVALID_INDEX) {
454  nextBucketIndex++;
455  }
456  if (nextBucketIndex < mHashSize) {
457  nextEntryIndex = mBuckets[nextBucketIndex];
458  }
459  }
460 
461  // We have found the next non empty entry
462  return Iterator(this, nextBucketIndex, nextEntryIndex);
463  }
464  }
465  }
466 
467  return end();
468  }
469 
471  Array<V> toArray(MemoryAllocator& arrayAllocator) const {
472 
473  Array<V> array(arrayAllocator);
474 
475  for (auto it = begin(); it != end(); ++it) {
476  array.add(*it);
477  }
478 
479  return array;
480  }
481 
483  void clear(bool releaseMemory = false) {
484 
485  for (uint64 i=0; i<mHashSize; i++) {
486 
487  uint64 entryIndex = mBuckets[i];
488  while(entryIndex != INVALID_INDEX) {
489 
490  // Destroy the entry
491  mEntries[entryIndex].~V();
492 
493  uint64 nextEntryIndex = mNextEntries[entryIndex];
494 
495  // Add entry to the free list
496  mNextEntries[entryIndex] = mFreeIndex;
497  mFreeIndex = entryIndex;
498 
499  entryIndex = nextEntryIndex;
500  }
501 
502  mBuckets[i] = INVALID_INDEX;
503  }
504 
505  if (releaseMemory && mNbAllocatedEntries > 0) {
506 
507  // Release previously allocated memory
508  mAllocator.release(mBuckets, mHashSize * sizeof(uint64));
509  mAllocator.release(mEntries, mNbAllocatedEntries * sizeof(V));
510  mAllocator.release(mNextEntries, mNbAllocatedEntries * sizeof(uint64));
511 
512  mBuckets = nullptr;
513  mEntries = nullptr;
514  mNextEntries = nullptr;
515 
516  mNbAllocatedEntries = 0;
517  mHashSize = 0;
518  }
519 
520  mNbEntries = 0;
521  }
522 
524  uint64 size() const {
525  return mNbEntries;
526  }
527 
529  uint64 capacity() const {
530  return mHashSize;
531  }
532 
536  Iterator find(const V& value) const {
537 
538  uint64 bucket;
539  uint64 entry = INVALID_INDEX;
540 
541  if (mHashSize > 0) {
542 
543  const size_t hashCode = Hash()(value);
544  const size_t divider = mHashSize - 1;
545  bucket = static_cast<uint64>(hashCode & divider);
546  auto keyEqual = KeyEqual();
547 
548  for (uint64 i = mBuckets[bucket]; i != INVALID_INDEX; i = mNextEntries[i]) {
549  if (Hash()(mEntries[i]) == hashCode && keyEqual(mEntries[i], value)) {
550  entry = i;
551  break;
552  }
553  }
554  }
555 
556  if (entry == INVALID_INDEX) {
557  return end();
558  }
559 
560  return Iterator(this, bucket, entry);
561  }
562 
564  bool operator==(const Set<V>& set) const {
565 
566  if (size() != set.size()) return false;
567 
568  for (auto it = begin(); it != end(); ++it) {
569  if(!set.contains(*it)) {
570  return false;
571  }
572  }
573 
574  return true;
575  }
576 
578  bool operator!=(const Set<V>& set) const {
579 
580  return !((*this) == set);
581  }
582 
584  Set<V>& operator=(const Set<V>& set) {
585 
586  // Check for self assignment
587  if (this != &set) {
588 
589  // Clear the set
590  clear(true);
591 
592  mNbAllocatedEntries = set.mNbAllocatedEntries;
593  mNbEntries = set.mNbEntries;
594  mHashSize = set.mHashSize;
595  mFreeIndex = set.mFreeIndex;
596 
597  if (mHashSize > 0) {
598 
599  // Allocate memory for the buckets
600  mBuckets = static_cast<uint64*>(mAllocator.allocate(mHashSize * sizeof(uint64)));
601 
602  // Allocate memory for the entries
603  mEntries = static_cast<V*>(mAllocator.allocate(mNbAllocatedEntries * sizeof(V)));
604  mNextEntries = static_cast<uint64*>(mAllocator.allocate(mNbAllocatedEntries * sizeof(uint64)));
605 
606  // Copy the buckets array
607  std::memcpy(mBuckets, set.mBuckets, mHashSize * sizeof(uint64));
608 
609  // Copy the next entries indices
610  std::memcpy(mNextEntries, set.mNextEntries, mNbAllocatedEntries * sizeof(uint64));
611 
612  // Copy the entries
613  for (uint64 i=0; i<mHashSize; i++) {
614 
615  uint64 entryIndex = mBuckets[i];
616  while(entryIndex != INVALID_INDEX) {
617 
618  // Copy the entry to the new location and destroy the previous one
619  new (mEntries + entryIndex) V(set.mEntries[entryIndex]);
620 
621  entryIndex = mNextEntries[entryIndex];
622  }
623  }
624  }
625  }
626 
627  return *this;
628  }
629 
631  Iterator begin() const {
632 
633  // If the set is empty
634  if (size() == 0) {
635 
636  // Return an iterator to the end
637  return end();
638  }
639 
640  // Find the first used entry
641  uint64 bucketIndex = 0;
642  while (mBuckets[bucketIndex] == INVALID_INDEX) {
643 
644  bucketIndex++;
645  }
646 
647  assert(bucketIndex < mHashSize);
648  assert(mBuckets[bucketIndex] != INVALID_INDEX);
649 
650  return Iterator(this, bucketIndex, mBuckets[bucketIndex]);
651  }
652 
654  Iterator end() const {
655 
656  return Iterator(this, mHashSize, 0);
657  }
658 
659  // ---------- Friendship ---------- //
660 
661  friend class Iterator;
662 };
663 
664 }
